title: Chandrayaan, chaiwala controversy
selftext:
[Chaiwala ](https://preview.redd.it/t86q0jx3ktjb1.jpg?width=1600&format=pjpg&auto=webp&s=a1468714c6832d6ed7bf642f01498f34a9b08e86)

The chaiwala is famous but does anyone know where it comes from? It was created by a 3d artist from Bangalore. The art went to places leaving the artist.

Unfortunately, we in India never worry about copyright, especially artists. Just crop the name and now anybody can use it. There have been many before. We are used to it.

The recent controversy surrounding the tweet with Chaiwala and Chandrayaan uses the image in a negative manner.

I want the community's support to separate the art from the issue and appreciate the artist's hard work. With the discussions surrounding this image, we need to keep in mind that art is subjective and open to interpretations. This image was created with a different intention but unfortunately came to fame with a different message.
comments: Agreed,  but wrt to this scenario  I'm  sure the artist would like to separate  himself from the said art given the "misintepretation". the message  was pretty much the same ,  just that bhakts misinterpreted it nd thought the chaiwala in the pic   was their Master .
In this scenario it is even more important for the artist to assert himself. I know the artist personally and his work was created out of a love for tea.
